reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 4th of July weekend at the hotel last year. Hotel was nice, really liked the bathrooms, but they were almost bigger than the living area. I did enjoy the pass through from the bath tub to see the TV.
reviews.title: 4th of July and the inhouse dining is closed?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only the bar was open on Sunday which I thought was strange since it was a holiday weekend. Luckley we found a great taco place around the corner.
reviews.title: Good Potential but Falling Short

reviews.text: The check in area with the old bank vault door was a great touch.
reviews.title: Elegant, spacious rooms and baths

reviews.text: Pros: Impressive lobby; decor; comfortable bedding; impressive (large) glass shower; high ceilings in rooms; solid cuisine in restaurant; outstanding gym equipment and exercise area; secure elevator usage to guest floors; complimentary shuttle handy for downtown destinations (e.g. Theatre district)
reviews.title: A sure-fire recommend

reviews.text: Cons: lackluster staff quality (characteristic of a chain hotel), particularly in the restaurant (Voice); small square footage for "Superior King" room; weak to unusable water pressure at lavatory (had to use the bathtub for washing hands); loud air conditioner; substandard ventilation in bathroom; one small and another smaller elevator, both slow; in room TV was 19" tube, substandard for a hotel of this quality; street noise audible at night; internet service - both wired and wireless, were so slow that they were useless; $28 for valet parking a bit much
reviews.title: Discounted rate = poor service

reviews.text: The hotel has a convenient location in downtown Houston, close to the Opera house. The restaurant Voice serves excellent food at reasonable prices.
reviews.title: No water, no phone

reviews.text: I stayed for one night as I had tickets for the nearby ballet. The shower in my room did not work. And so didn't the phone. So I had to dress and walk down to reception. I was told that it will be fixed, but not in time for my dinner and theatre appointment. The shower worked the next morning, but the phone still not.
reviews.title: Don't bother

reviews.text: And they charge an extra 20% re-stocking fee on minibar items. Isn't that hillarious? Isn't re-stocking part of a minibar anyway? Why not include the re-stocking costs in the initial published price?
reviews.title: great unique hotel

reviews.text: I stayed an evening here to try the hotel out since I travel to Houston a few times per month. What a disappointment. If they offer you an upgraded room, be sure to ask if it is an handicapped room. I was checked into one and all the charm was lost. An outdated TV with the faceplate broken off, no claw footed tub, it was a handicapped tub and show with a fold down bench seat that I bumped into while showering. I was hoping for the charm of a boutique hotel. Far from it. The decor in my room (handicapped) was terrible. I will say that it isn't the same as in the photos online. It may just be this type of room. I wouldn't stay here again and will go back to the Galleria area where I typically stay in Houston. It just doesn't make the grade in my opinion for what they tout themselves as. The best thing about this hotel, at least in the room I stayed in was the free internet.
reviews.title: Go Bold or Stay Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great unique hotel. Rooms large, comfortable, clean, and well appointed. Was in Houston for a convention. Hotel provided free shuttle service. Not a bad walk however and close to the light rail.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.text: Just got back from Houston trip and a 2-night stay at the Hotel ICON. From the street you can’t really identify the hotel, which I find out later, is why so many celebrities stay at this hotel. Un assuming hotel this is not! Once in the auto Cade the hotel unveils itself as a top notch Houston Hotel that likes to be on the DL and does need to boost its superior service.
reviews.title: Great Houston Gem - Excellent Hotel for Business trip with flare

reviews.text: Firstly, I have to thank Cheryl on the front desk. She is an amazing hotel professional – Cheryl is personable, helpful and welcoming without any air of superficiality. She framed the entire stay where nothing was a problem. This transpired to all the staff from Bellman to Room Service. The Staff at this hotel are spot on and carry the charm of this well designed lodging. Old school Houston meets London Club is very much the interior tone of the public spaces and rooms. My room was great – huge corner room with vestibule and fantastic bathroom complete with rain shower. This room was truly comfortable which starts to confirm my thoughts on avoiding new design hotels, which just say “We are fabulous but you wont be comfortable!” The rooms, like the hotel, are clean and well maintained and not showing any age. The restaurant and bar is excellent and I ate there through out my stay. They have a shuttle (a huge Cadillac)which will take you anywhere at any time and again with the drivers having a great attitude.
reviews.title: Old world charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think I have to go back to Cheryl as she really set this hotel up as a great business retreat with her fantastic professional attitude. So many hotels could learn something from her. Thanks Cheryl I will be back!
reviews.title: Any hotel with chandeliers in the carpark...

reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay there, found the decor to be charming and elegant and my bed was comfortable. The bathroom was nice and roomy too. Further, I was well taken care of there and thought the shuttle service was very helpful and accommodating.
reviews.title: Would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ...must be good, and we were suitably impressed by our stay at Hotel Icon. The design and attention to detail were excellent, with lots of nice Houston and Texan accents. We got upgraded into a junior suite, which was definitely a pleasant surprise. Our suite was huge with lovely facilities. The staff were extremely helpful and on the whole we were very happy with our decision to stay there. We'd definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Beautifull hotel but HAUNTED!
Perfect getaway
reviews.text: Wife and i spent the night here in conjunction with a business dinner and found the hotel and staff fantastic. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and went overboard to be helpful. It was a nice quiet getway in the middle of a big city. They have done wonders with converting this old bank building and the food was outstanding. Would have liked to seen more variety for the menu though. Rooms were cozy and very well decorated.
Will go back when in town.
reviews.title: Great Room, Great Staff, Great Location - can't wait to stay here again

reviews.text: I stayed here for the first time in April 2011 and had a great experience. The staff is professional, down to earth and very nice. The hotel has a lot of charm and a great vibe . They offer small refrigerators on a first come first serve basis and since I was staying here for 4 days I asked for one, but they were all in use. A day later I get back to my room and a fridge in waiting for me, I open it up and it still has the tape on the shelves from the store - they actually went out and bought one for me to use - blew me away!
reviews.title: A great first time experience at the Hotel Icon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I normally request a room away from the elevator, but not in this case. the bed and desk are away from the hallway so there was no noise AND this corner room had 3 windows with great view of downtown. The bar and restaurant are awesome as well!
reviews.title: Very Charming Hotel in Downtown Houston

reviews.text: I am a fairly regular visitor to Houston on business, and stayed at Hotel Icon for the first time this past week---and was very pleasantly surprised. It's a vintage bank building converted into a boutique style hotel, and overall is very nicely done and well executed.
reviews.title: Great Stay in downtown Houston!
